messages.subject: Re: Cats & Birds
messages.msgSnippet: I came across this and thought I would pass it on because of the recent discussion of cats & birds.  Family Pastimes has a cooperative (players work together
messages.messageBody:
I came across this and thought I would pass it on because of the recent
discussion of cats & birds. Family Pastimes has a cooperative (players
work together rather than against each other) board game called MAX
(which won a top-rating from Canada Toy Testing). Here is the
description from the catalog:

We must help get the little Creatures safely home before Max, the Tomcat,
catches them. In an exciting way, children learn logic, consultation &
decision making. An important issue to discuss is also raised: we don't
like Max catching those Little Ones, yet we recognize that he is a
natural hunter. How do we resolve this in our minds & hearts? Let's
talk it over. Ages: 4-7 Play alone or with as many as 8 players. ($14
US, includes shipping) 1-888-267-4414 or fp@...

Mary Ellen
Give plenty of time to your children.
Be patient with your spouse, coworkers, and friends.
Everywhere, take your time.
